channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway's Stock Is So Rich Even Berkshire Is Buying Less of It
item.description: Stock buybacks have slowed to a trickle. “If Buffett’s not buying his own stock, then why should we?” one investor asked.

item.title: What traders are saying about new election-betting rules: ‘I can put money on the candidate I don’t want to win’
item.description: Just hours after it began, legal betting on the outcome of U.S. Congressional elections was put on hold by a federal appeals court.

item.title: What's Left to Be ETF'd?
item.description: There’s an ETF for nearly everything, but good ones are rare.

item.title: ‘My husband blew a gasket’: I bought a $20,000 Toyota SUV using financing. My spouse said, ‘Pay it off immediately.’ Did I get a bad deal?
item.description: “I couldn’t get a cashier’s check at the dealer yesterday as I had my four kids with me.”

item.title: Why Natural Gas Will Stay Under Pressure
item.description: A hot summer and production curtailments haven’t been enough to eliminate the surplus natural gas in U.S. storage.

item.title: ‘I have zero regrets’: I’m 84 and estranged from my two adult sons. My 48-year-old wife will get my seven-figure estate. Is that selfish?
item.description: “My will and trust will exclude everyone that carries my family name.”

item.title: China Is Risking a Deflationary Spiral
item.description: Wall Street economists are calling for more fiscal stimulus in the country. But Beijing may still not act boldly enough.

item.title: ‘I’m trapped between warring siblings’: My late father left a ledger with $80,000 in unpaid loans to my brothers. Can the executor force them to pay?
item.description: “His will states that his estate is to be divided equally among his five children.”

item.title: Your 529 College-Savings Plan Can Now Fund a Roth IRA
item.description: Parents with leftover money in college funds can now move them to retirement accounts—maybe even their own. But should they?

item.title: ‘My mom still has his original will’: A few months before he died, my father went online and made a secret will, cutting off my mother. Can he do this?
item.description: “His new will leaves his estate to my two nieces, nephew, my sister and me.”
